headline: Windows laptop recommendations for my student niece?
description:
I am trying to help my brother find the right laptop for his daughter. Her school sent out some basic requirements which are:

- PC with Windows - At least 8GB memory - At least 200GB storage - processor that can handle video conferences (they claim some weaker processors can't handle video meetings), ideally with built-in webcam

I'm a Mac user and I don't know much about Windows machines so don't really know where to start. All I know is that there are many laptops that fit the bill specs-wise, but many are cheap with crappy screens and poor overall performance.

I think they're willing to spend $1,000-$1,500.

Appreciate any guidance you can provide. Thank you!
